_header: The kings son swear by Gods cross
_description:
A fifteenth-century fragment of a variant text of Bevis of Hamptoun (corresponds to pp. 129-144 of Kölbing (1885)
XKölbing, Eugen. The Romance of Sir Beues of Hamtoun.
EETS e.s. 46 (1885), 48 (1886), 65 (1894); repr. 1973 see 3250)

CamTCC1117.First Lines:
…The kynges sone swer by godes CrosseThat he shuld Aryndedell
                    stele…
CamTCC1117.Last Lines:
…Steward he was of that londeAs sabir gan to vnder
                    stonde
CamTCC1117.Note:
Below (as a chorus?): ‘As sabyr gan to vnder stonde / Amen for
                    sent charite / Amen for / As sabyr gan to vndrstond / Amen’ (f.
                    152)
